sentences.english: It is a common fallacy to regard school as theonly workshop for the acquisition of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 視學校爲汲取知識的唯一場所是種常見的謬誤。

sentences.english: Being right half the time beats being half-right all the time.
sentences.chinese: 不怕半生皆是謬誤，只怕一生似是而非。

sentences.english: Fallacy theory is an important constituent of Mohist school's logic.
sentences.chinese: 謬誤論是墨家邏輯的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Let me enumerate many flaws in your hypothesis.
sentences.chinese: 讓我列舉你前提中的許多謬誤。

sentences.english: Person-oriented argumentation and fallacy of personal abuse should be distinguished.
sentences.chinese: “針對人的”論證與“人身攻擊”謬誤應加以區分。

sentences.english: It is sometimes difficult to disentangle truth from falsehood.
sentences.chinese: 分清真理和謬誤有時很難。

sentences.english: In the course of the argument, the most enormous errors of fact simply pullulated.
sentences.chinese: 在爭論過程中，最厲害的事實謬誤簡直有增無減。
正確走向極端即成謬誤。

sentences.english: This is probably the fallacy least-well-addressed by the Web.
sentences.chinese: 這個謬誤可能是Web處理的最差一個了。

sentences.english: The stream of truth flows though its channels of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 真理的細流沿着謬誤的溝渠川流而過。

sentences.english: If not go to this fallacy, since at odds with Western civilization.
sentences.chinese: 若非去此謬誤，自與西洋文明扞格不入。

sentences.english: There are so many fallacies in this view that they cannot all be disentangled at once.
sentences.chinese: 這種論調中存在好些謬誤，很難一下子梳理清楚。

sentences.english: If you do not sign on to this claim, you are committing the third health care cost fallacy.
sentences.chinese: 假如你不簽署這個聲明，你將會犯第三醫療成本謬誤。

sentences.english: It is true that 'one step beyond truth is absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 所謂‘真理往前跨出一步就是謬誤’。

sentences.english: This is where the myth of half-orc stupidity becomes glaringly incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 由此，認定半獸人愚笨的傳言顯然是謬誤。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
methodology/Discours de la méthode by René Descartes 笛卡兒|笛卡儿[Di2 ka3 er2], 1637
